reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel gave us endless problems. When we arrived it was mid-afternoon and we couldn't check in until 5, the room that we were eventually given was by no means a 'superieur' room that we had paid for. We asked to be moved as we looked out the back of the hotel onto a wall and we had paid for a room with a view and all we got was a small room at the back with bars on the window. The manager was incredibly rude, quickly turning agressive. He doesn't seem to want to run a hotel - just a restaurant. The next morning the breakfast was passable, even if the service was terrible - we waited 15 mins for orange juice. However the next morning before we checked out we were denied even this. Apparently if you want breakfast you have to have dinner at the hotel the night before! There were non-hotel guests eating breakfast but we were not served. We paid our over-priced bill and left. It seems that if you don't complain and do what they tell you and sit where they tell you then they are reasonably nice but the moment you make any requests (as is your right in a hotel) they are incredibly rude and agressive and told us if we don't like it then go somewhere else and our room will be filled almost immediately! Please don't stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Half the fun is getting there, we drove the 2 hours from Nice airport and noted all the little villages and wineries along the way to visit over the next few days. We came primarily to photograph the lavender fields and relax in the country. Hotel du Vieux Chateau was the perfect little hotel and Aiguines, although tiny, is so charming.
reviews.title: Lovely hosts, solid little hotel, great location for touring Provence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TIP: Drive up to the fountain in front of the hotel and drop off your bags, then park back down the way you came. If you are unable to carry bags up stairs, ask for a lower room upon reservation or I am sure they will help. Our room was very basic, but good value for the money, with quite a large bathroom. We were on the top floor with a tiny window with a view of the town square below and just above the lake. Another bit of advice, if you are a light sleeper, be forewarned that the town clock goes off ALL night. We were torn between keeping the window closed to block the noise, or having fresh air as it was July.
reviews.title: Too bad...

likes.disliked: — The lack of hospitality of the lady manager, and the fact that the rooms are not soundproof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meals are 1/2 board. Don't bother with breakfast as it is just tea/
reviews.title: Charming village and hotel
great place to stay
reviews.text: coffee/toast/jam. Instead walk 25 ft to Autour de la Table and buy their wonderful chevre frais and then pop up the stairs to the boulangerie just down the street and buy a lovely fresh baguette. The first night we had the set dinner, it was fine, but you are limited in your choices obviously. Second evening we ate at the restaurant just around the bend - Altitude 823 (Aiguine's altitude). We had the local meat stew called Daube. Described here by Wikipedia: "Daube provençale is a stew made with cubed beef braised in wine, vegetables, garlic, and herbes de provence. Variations also call for olives, prunes, and flavoring with duck fat, vinegar, brandy, lavender, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, juniper berries, or orange peel." It was so good, that the next night we ate back at the Chateau and asked for a la carte and had their version of Daube - wonderful!.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mostly positives. Despite some concerns based on experiences described in other reviews, we were treated with courtesy and friendliness at every turn. The setting of the hotel is great: you are directly on the small village square overlooking the fountain and the hotel's outdoor cafe tables. The church also faces the same square and it does have bells that ring in the usual French way, but they seemed to stop about 9 or 10 PM. Free parking was readily available on the street a very short walk away and the car could pull up to the hotel's main doors for luggage loading and unloading. We did demi-pension and found our dinners to be be very good. The breakfasts were modest but nothing tasted to us like it came from the supermarket. Quite the contrary. Drawbacks: for most rooms, you will have to navigate some steep stairs. If you get a view room (we did), the view is very pretty Lake St. Croix in the distance, the local chateau and the town square nearer), but the distant view is only over the top of an adjacent building that blocks most of the view, and the window is configured such that you kind of have to squat down and lean forward through the window to really benefit from the view. The room was reasonably good-sized and the bathroom bigger than normal, although the room was modest and a little worn, but entirely consistent with the hotel's two-star rating. If you arrive with realistic two-star expectations, you will like this place.
reviews.title: A good experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this charming hotel. The staff was warm, friendly and lots of fun. We felt we had personal attention and the food was wonderful. The room was comfortable and location great for hiking and touring the canyon.
reviews.title: Charming, fun and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a model of rudeness! We called ahead from Moustiers to ask about a room for the night. We were told in reassuring tones that they had availability. The arrangement was that we would come over and have a look. No indication was given that we might need to hurry or reserve. When we arrived, the manager, who had taken the call, listened to us and then walked slowly over to the bar, where he proceeded to turn pages in a large book. As the pages moved, so his head began to move, shaking from side to side. He returned to tell us the there was nothing available, without a hint of regret. When we reminded him that we had called, he told us in a clipped, schoolmasterly tone that we had called sometime ago, and stood staring at us. Was it smugness or indifference that held his face so tight? Although it was clear that we were now without anywhere to stay at 8pm, our new friend did not condescend to offer any advice as to alternative places, but confined himself to a perfunctory 'desolée' and let us wander out into the night. This hotel looks reasonably warm and pleasing from the outside, but take a thick coat with you if you venture into its cold interior. Alternatively, think carefully whom you might wish it upon.
reviews.title: Cold comfort farm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked this place. It is in a very pretty French square with simple but charmingly furnished rooms. We paid extra for a room overlooking the square and took the half board deal. The food was good, simple provencal mountain fayre. The owners were polite and pleasant, if a little flustered at times. The hotel shuts up at 10pm but we didn't mind as there is very little to do in Aiguines of an evening. However it is a tranquil and pleasant base for exploring the Verdon gorge and we hope to return.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the lady manager sharp by demanding my card immediately I was through the door. I asked for wifi access and she said I could get it the next day as the boss was away. I asked if she could call the boss then she told me it was 5 Euro. She unable to tell me if it was for 1 hour, 1 day or all of our stay (2 nights), I said I would pay the next day; she then gave me a code for the wifi It didn't work and she gave me no answer as to why it didn't.
reviews.title: OK If You Can Tolerate Church Bells Every Hour
